BC Reference Model Version 1.0.0
cimi

Element RecordedContext

Documentation:
Context for an evaluation result, used to indicate an evaluation has been made. For example, measurement of blood pressure that has been made simply exists (although the value can be present or absent, accurate or inaccurate). The RecordedContext indicates the information presented stands on its own as presented. It can also apply to a clinical notes. The RecordedContext class did not exist in CIMI Version 0.0.4, but CIMI is the process of adding it. That change is anticipated here.
Ancestors:
  • Locatable

      FindingStatus
      Indicates whether the finding is preliminary, amended, final, etc..
      DataType

      FindingStatus

      ExceptionValue
      Reason that a value associated with a test or other finding is missing.
      DataType
      Cardinality
      ExceptionValue
      0..1
      RelevantTime
      The time or time period that the finding addresses. The clinically relevant time is not necessarily when the information is gathered or when a test is carried out, but for example, when a specimen was collected, or the time period referred to by the question. Use a TimePeriod for a measurement or specimen collection continued over a significant period of time (e.g. 24 hour Urine Sodium).
      DataType
      Cardinality
      RelevantTime
      0..1
